The KAIST IAM group, within the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology, employs state-of-the-art Integrated Assessment Modeling (IAM) tools to analyze and guide the transition to a carbon-neutral future. Their interdisciplinary approach combines environmental science, energy system engineering, economics, and policy expertise to simulate scenarios and propose effective solutions for achieving a sustainable, low-carbon economy. Through detailed analyses, they assist policymakers in making informed decisions on energy decarbonization pathways, contributing to a climate resilient and environmentally sustainable global future. The KAIST IAM group's impact extends beyond academia, influencing policy discussions and shaping a shared vision for a sustainable planet.
